intro: Meriania denticulata, commonly known as the toothed meriania, is a flowering plant species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, often found in moist, shaded forest understories. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have finely serrated margins, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Meriania denticulata is valued in horticulture for its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms.
